answers.answer: Hi Thereif you have been under careful medical attention and you have had an ultrasound to look at your ovaries, your symptoms are most likely irritable bowel. perhaps your diabetes and lupus play a role in the abdominal irritation that you feel.It is important to follow up with your doctor and get follow up scans at least once a yearbest wishes

question: Dear Doctor,I have suffered from abdominal pain, bloating (uncomfortable on the side of my abdomen) for a few years now. It started when I was dxed with lupus.  I have seen a gi doctor who dx me with bacterial overgrowth.  I took abx twice for the episodes but it seems to return every 6 months or so.  Also I have SOB when the bloating is bad and abd pain, chest discomfort.  My cardiologist does not think it is cardiac in nature since I excercise regularly and the symptoms do not occur with excercise.  In fact excercise seems to help the bloating abit.  I am also a type 1 diabetic.  Could it be my gallbladder? or worse yet do I need to consider ovarian cancer?  since breast cancer runs in my family?  I know it is hard to determine since I have 2 chronic illness but I am just wondering what steps to take next.  It does seem to be precipitated by stress or periods of not eating appropriately having a glass of wine etc.  Thanks
title: abdominal bloating, sob
